definition: see 誇海口|夸海口[kua1 hai3 kou3]
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action
ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: There’s no doubt that law schools have overbuilt and that the legal profession has overpromised.
sentences.chinese: 毫無疑問，法學院過多了，並對法定職業誇下海口。

sentences.english: Bill will promise you the moon, but he won't live up to his promises.
sentences.chinese: 比爾會爲你誇下海口，但他是不會兌現承諾的。

sentences.english: Bill wil promise you the moon, but he won't live up to his promises.
sentences.chinese: 比爾會爲你誇下海口，但他是不會兌現承諾的。

sentences.english: He had boasted loudly, but he could not carry out his threats.
sentences.chinese: 雖然他誇下海口，但卻未能如其所願。
